Characters.name: Wolverine
Characters.dis: Wolverine (real name James 'Logan' Howlvett) is one of the main characters in the Marvel Studios Animation series X-Men '97, a revival/sequel of the 1992 X-Men animated series. He is a mutant member of the X-Men who previously had his memories erased, as well as having his skeleton fused with Adamantium which gave him retractable Adamantium claws.
Characters.disPer:
Logan is a loner and someone who does things his own way, even if it means going off on his own. He can be headstrong, hardheaded, and even violent at times, coming off as a jerk and brute to anyone who sees him act this way, his friends included. 

          Despite his lone wolf persona and rude attitude, he is honorable as he refuses to hurt ordinary civilians, even if they express hate towards him or mutants in general. He also has a soft side as well, showing care for other people, especially his teammates. He is been shown to have romantic feelings for Jean Grey, showing affection and kindness towards her even after her and Cyclops were married, however, he respects her choice, and even sometimes rejects her advances due to believing she still loves Scott, thus wanting to prevent her from suffering loss.
pab: Superhuman Senses: Wolverine is known to possess extremely acute and heightened senses, allowing him to hear, see, smell, taste, and even feel things that no normal human being can.
Accelerated Healing Factor: Wolverine possesses a 'healing factor' that allows him to completely regenerate lost and damaged tissue instantaneously. He is also immortal due to such a power.
Immortality: Wolverine's healing factor has also kept him in the physical prime of a normal man for decades, and he will never age as a result.
Retractable Bone Claws: Wolverine possesses a pair of retractable razor-sharp claws that he can deploy between his knuckles.

Adamantium Skeleton: Upon entering the Weapon X program, Wolverine's entire skeletal structure was upgraded with Adamantium; which is a virtually indestructible alloy. Wolverine is capable of taking even more damage when he is on the offensive because of his skeleton.

Characters.name: Storm
Characters.dis: Ororo Munroe, also known as Storm, is a mutant and member of the X-Men. She comes from Africa. She would also be leader of the Morlocks for a long time.
Characters.disPer:
Storm is a responsible person who is an effective leader of the X-Men. She is always seeking the best way through any situation. She is often witty, when simply talking to her fellow X-Men and does seem to have a good sense of humor. 

          She has a great deal of self-control, as her powers are controlled by her emotions, so if she was to feel anger to a great extent, she would often be the cause unbelievable damage and become a danger to her friends. 

          She suffers from claustrophobia. This stems from a bad experience she had as a child where she was almost buried alive. When she is in confined spaces she freaks out and her powers get out of control.
pab: Storm is a mutant with the ability to control and manipulate the forces of nature. The nature of her powers grant her control over wind, rain, lightning, hurricanes, ice and heat.

Her precise control over the forces of nature enables her to achieve a wide variety of weather such as making whirlwinds travel pointing lengthwise in any direction, flash freezing objects and people, and summoning wind currents strong enough to support her weight and make her herself and others fly and hover.

Characters.name: Rogue
Characters.dis: Anna Marie Darkholme, also known as Rogue, is a mutant and a member of the X-Men.
Characters.disPer:
Rogue was beautiful and smart with a great sense of humor, a heart of gold, an independent nature, and a lot of spirit. She usually had an attitude of good-natured irreverence. Rogue occasionally referred to everyone including even her enemies as “hon” and “sugar” and spoke in a sassy Southern accent. She was a bit of a flirt and flirted with any man she found to be attractive such as Cyclops, Colossus, Archangel, and Spider-Man during her time as a hero. 

          Rogue has; proven herself to be a valuable asset of the X-Men and examples of her heroic deeds; include her attempt to confront Magneto; during his attack on Metro Chemical Plant, the crushing of the Sentinels in order to save Senator Robert Kelly’s life, the defeat of Mister Sinister and the Nasty Boys in Savage Land, the help she gave the other X-Men when they temporarily worked together with the Shi'ar Princess Lilandra to avoid the crisis involving the M’Kraan Crystal and the Dark Phoenix, and her three run-ins with Apocalypse. 

          Rogue has a close friendship with Storm, deeply respected Professor Xavier and generally got along well; with Beast, Cyclops, Gambit, Jubilee, Jean Grey, Morph, and Wolverine. But she was unafraid to call Wolverine names, insult him, yell at him, argue with him or threaten to get into a fight; with him; whenever he annoyed her or; made her angry. The fact that; she possessed invulnerability as one of her powers more than likely was a factor in this; she knew he could not hurt her, so she could get away with stuff other people could not. 

          Despite Rogue being heroic; she can sometimes be headstrong, short-tempered, hot-headed and selfish; but will always do the right thing in the end. 

          In X-Men '97, Rogue's old romantic feelings towards Magneto has been rekindled, after he became the new leader of the X-Men, leaving Gambit in the dust. Because of her romantic attraction towards Magneto, Rogue has become more arrogant and selfish towards other individuals. After the Genosha Island attack, Rogue is severely traumatized and ridden with survivors guilt, she began attacking military bases all over the world and almost attempted murder on Baston. But once Magneto had threaten the world by cutting off all power and electricity, Rogue had sided; with him; instead of the X-Men, officially; leaving the team and; even physically attacked Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Jean and Storm; when they try to stop Magneto. 

          At this point, Rogue is no longer the misunderstood hero she was, she is now an aggressive, bitter, cold, ruthless and violent terrorist; who despises humans, willing to let them go extinct and she is most likely now an enemy of the X-Men; proving that; Gambit's death, as well as the death of the other mutants on Genosha has not only; resulted in Rogue's personality becoming far more darker; but she has also lost her sense of justice, honor and morals; in the process.
pab: Rogue has the ability to absorb energy from other living beings through physical contact as well as temporarily gain mutant powers and thoughts. However this makes it hard for her to be in contact with anyone unless she has protection such as her gloves.
After absorbing Ms. Marvel's powers permanently, she gained the power of flight, superhuman strength and invulnerability.

Characters.name: Gambit
Characters.dis: Remy LeBeau, also known as Gambit, was a mutant, member of the X-Men and former member of the Thieves' Guild.
Characters.disPer:
Gambit is often depicted as a smooth-talking, charismatic individual who easily wins people over with his charm. His Cajun accent and playful demeanor add to his allure, making him a fan-favorite character. 

          He embodies the archetype of a charming rogue, often engaging in thievery and deception. Despite his criminal background, Gambit seeks redemption and strives to be a hero, which adds depth to his character. 

          Gambit's past as a thief and his connections to the Thieves' Guild create a morally ambiguous character. He often grapples with his loyalties, especially regarding his relationships with the X-Men and his on-again, off-again love interest, Rogue.
pab: Gambit has the ability to change objects with explosive charges of kinetic energy that his body produces from non-organic matter. He commonly does this to playing cards since he can easily store them and throw the cards. However, this means he goes through them quickly and is often buying new packs of cards. He can also do this to other objects, such as a brick, but does this less often.
He also has a extendable metal Bo-staff that he uses for fending off further attacks and is skilled in martial arts. Gambit also regularly exercises and has the skills of a master thief.
